It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white, tubular flowers that bloom in spring. Schamsia ligustrica is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
